page.title: 15Keadby Wharf
page.content: When a ship arrives a self-employed man arrives to moor up the ship at all hours of the day.The ships are brought up the river by the pilot because of the danger of shifting sandbanks.Their cargoes are unloaded into lorries which have been contracted out to the owners of the cargoes.The lorries first go to a local hauliers firm weighbridge before going onto their destination. The wharf is registered NABSA-not always afloat but safe aground.At low tide the ship settles into the mud.On mooring certain officials arrive to meet the boat-1.Customs men.2."Black" gang customs men who make spot checks on boats.3.Immigration officials.4. Port Health Authority Officials who check for sickness and rabies.5.Ships chandler who will supply a ship with fuel,water or supplies if needed.
